availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Mitchell (Caldwell County, Ky, farmer and carpenter)

body.p: Trigg County and Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and carpenter. Kentucky native. Son of James Mitchell and [Unknown] Ethridge Mitchell. Father of Charles Mitchell. Married to Pernecia Harris Mitchell. Father of John C. Mitchell, Eliza Mitchell, James T. Mitchell, Luiza J. Mitchell, Mary Mitchell, Ellenora Mitchell, and Sarah D. Mitchell. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Carpenter in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 318A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 82.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, Enumeration District 158, p. 438B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994056, Trigg County Births, p. 991.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #29415.
"William J. Mitchell (1838-1912)," Find A Grave, Memorial #178065767, accessed January 5, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/178065767.
